# pds.dynamic_index { #planetarypy.pds.dynamic_index }

`pds.dynamic_index`

Dynamic index management

These are the codes for web-scraped PDS archive pages to discover the most recent 
volume delivery with a new index file and its URL.

## Classes

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [DynamicRemoteHandler](#planetarypy.pds.dynamic_index.DynamicRemoteHandler) | Manages dynamic index URLs and their discovery/caching. |

### DynamicRemoteHandler { #planetarypy.pds.dynamic_index.DynamicRemoteHandler }

```python
pds.dynamic_index.DynamicRemoteHandler(index_key)
```

[[source]](https://github.com/michaelaye/planetarypy/blob/main/src/planetarypy/pds/dynamic_index.py#L20-L142){.source-link target="_blank"}

Manages dynamic index URLs and their discovery/caching.

It uses the AccessLog to track TWO URLs:
1. current_url: The URL of the locally cached index
2. available_url: The URL of a newly discovered update (if any)

This separation ensures we always know which URL corresponds to our cached data.

#### Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name      | Type   | Description                                | Default    |
|-----------|--------|--------------------------------------------|------------|
| index_key | str    | The dotted index key (e.g. "mro.ctx.edr"). | _required_ |

#### Attributes

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [handler_class](#planetarypy.pds.dynamic_index.DynamicRemoteHandler.handler_class) | Get handler class. |
| [should_check](#planetarypy.pds.dynamic_index.DynamicRemoteHandler.should_check) | Determine if we should check for updates based on last check time. |
| [update_available](#planetarypy.pds.dynamic_index.DynamicRemoteHandler.update_available) | Check if an update is available. |
| [url](#planetarypy.pds.dynamic_index.DynamicRemoteHandler.url) | Get the URL to use for downloading. |

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [discover_latest_url](#planetarypy.pds.dynamic_index.DynamicRemoteHandler.discover_latest_url) | Discover the latest index URL from the remote source. |

##### discover_latest_url { #planetarypy.pds.dynamic_index.DynamicRemoteHandler.discover_latest_url }

```python
pds.dynamic_index.DynamicRemoteHandler.discover_latest_url()
```

Discover the latest index URL from the remote source.

This method only discovers and returns the URL - it does NOT update any logs.
Logging is handled by the caller based on what they want to do with the URL.

[[source]](https://github.com/michaelaye/planetarypy/blob/main/src/planetarypy/pds/dynamic_index.py#L52-L73){.source-link target="_blank"}
